intro: Galium leiophyllum, commonly known as smooth woodryard, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems that root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium leiophyllum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
